page.title: 20STONEACRE, OTHAM
page.content: Stoneacre is a small half-timbered manor house built by John Ellys in the 1480s in Otham parish at 799535. It has been much altered since then and many additions,especially a north-west wing, were made by its American owner, Aymer Vallance, before he presented it to the National Trust in 1928. He also added panelling, furniture, and paintings considered appropriate to his restoration of the timber framing. The property is still occupied by private tenants, but the house and gardens are now open to the public, at a charge of Â£1 per head, on Wednesday and Saturday afternoons from April to September inclusive. {(Pages 1-6,9,12-13,20 contributed by {Maidstone Grammar School, 7-8,10-11 by {Molehill Copse School, 14-16 by {Roseacre School, 17-19 by Madginford {Park School) }
